data.text:
Join Us for Amersham Heritage Day on September 8th!

Experience the charm and history of Amersham at this year’s Heritage Day, taking place on Sunday, September 8th. This vibrant event promises a delightful mix of activities, entertainment, and historical exploration for the whole family.

What to Expect:

Classic Car Displays:

Admire a stunning collection of classic and vintage cars that will line the High Street. Car enthusiasts will have a unique opportunity to view these beautiful vehicles up close and chat with their proud owners.

Medieval Re-enactments and Historical Tours:

Step back in time with fascinating medieval re-enactments, complete with knights, armour, and historical demonstrations. Join one of the guided tours to learn about Amersham’s rich past, including its architecture, notable events, and famous residents.

Children’s Activities:

There will be plenty of fun for the younger visitors with children’s funfair rides and engaging activities designed to entertain and educate. From face painting to interactive games, there’s something to keep every child delighted.

Live Entertainment:

Enjoy a lively atmosphere with performances from marching bands, Morris dancers, and live music acts throughout the day. The streets of Old Amersham will be filled with joyous sounds and vibrant performances.

Heritage Bus Journeys:

Take a nostalgic ride on one of the heritage buses and see the town from a different perspective. These bus journeys offer a glimpse into the past, highlighting the evolution of transportation in Amersham.

Market Stalls and Local Crafts:

Browse a variety of market stalls offering local produce, handmade crafts, and unique gifts. It’s the perfect opportunity to support local artisans and find something special to take home.

Special Museum Exhibits:

Visit the Amersham Museum for a special entrance fee of just £1 for adults, with children entering for free. The museum will showcase unique models of the town in miniature and offer hands-on activities in the herbal garden, including insights into traditional medicinal plants, and a Tudor Taster Walk, led by expert costumed guides (meet at the porch of St Mary’s Church for a circular walk that includes a walk uphill to the Martyrs Memorial. Walks last one hour. No charge, just turn up on the day. Walks start at 12noon and 14.15).

Amersham Heritage Day is not just an event; it’s a celebration of our town’s heritage and community spirit. Whether you’re a history buff, a car enthusiast, or looking for a fun family day out, there’s something for everyone.

Plan Your Visit:

Date: Sunday, September 8th

Time: 11:30 AM – 5:30 PM

Location: High Street, Old Amersham, Buckinghamshire, HP7 0DJ

Entry: Free

Mark your calendars and come join us for a day full of history, culture, and fun at Amersham Heritage Day! Stay tuned for more details coming soon.
